content.raw:
The sdformat specification requires a `geometry` element as a child of `visual`. So this is arguably an invalid model. The question is when we should detect it and how to respond.

I just tested this in two separate ways:

* Run `gazebo --verbose` and insert this model from the InsertModelWidget; an error message is printed, and the model fails to load, but the server continues running.
~~~
[Err] [msgs.cc:591] EXCEPTION: Invalid geometry element

[Err] [World.cc:1691] Loading model from factory message failed
~~~

* Load a world file with this type of mal-formed model, and the server fails to load:
~~~
[Err] [msgs.cc:591] EXCEPTION: Invalid geometry element

[Err] [Server.cc:373] EXCEPTION: Failed to load the World
Invalid geometry element


[Err] [Server.cc:373] EXCEPTION: Failed to load the World
Invalid geometry element
~~~
content.html:
The sdformat specification requires a geometry element as a child of visual. So this is arguably an invalid model. The question is when we should detect it and how to respond.

I just tested this in two separate ways:

  • Run gazebo --verbose and insert this model from the InsertModelWidget; an error message is printed, and the model fails to load, but the server continues running.
[Err] [msgs.cc:591] EXCEPTION: Invalid geometry element

[Err] [World.cc:1691] Loading model from factory message failed
  • Load a world file with this type of mal-formed model, and the server fails to load:
[Err] [msgs.cc:591] EXCEPTION: Invalid geometry element

[Err] [Server.cc:373] EXCEPTION: Failed to load the World
Invalid geometry element


[Err] [Server.cc:373] EXCEPTION: Failed to load the World
Invalid geometry element
